byline.original: By THOM SHANKER and STEVEN LEE MYERS
byline.contributor: Thom Shanker reported from MacDill Air Force Base, and Steven Lee Myers from Washington.

abstract: Obama administration plans to bolster American military presence in the Persian Gulf after it withdraws remaining troops from Iraq; repositioning could include new combat forces in Kuwait able to respond to a collapse of security in Iraq or a military confrontation with Iran.
snippet: The bolstering of American troops could include new combat forces in Kuwait able to respond to a collapse of security in Iraq or a confrontation with Iran.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: The bolstering of American troops could include new combat forces in Kuwait able to respond to a collapse of security in Iraq or a confrontation with Iran.

headline.main: U.S. Planning Troop Buildup in Gulf After Exit From Iraq
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Planning Buildup in Gulf After Iraq Exit
headline.seo: U.S. Plans Post-Iraq Troop Increase in Persian Gulf
